meanings.definition: A type of housing with two separate living spaces stacked on top of each other.
meanings.sent1: The bilevels in our neighborhood have a downstairs apartment and an upstairs one.
meanings.sent2: We visited a friend who lives in bilevels, and their living room is on the first floor.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about a family who couldn't decide which bilevel to live in, so they bought both!
meanings.sent4: The bilevels in the city stood tall like a double-decker bus, each level a home.
meanings.sent5: The bilevels were like a two-story book, each page a different family's story.

meanings.sent1: The cake had a bilevels design, with chocolate on top and vanilla below.
meanings.sent2: The new office building has a bilevels structure, with offices on both floors.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich looked funny with its bilevels of ham and cheese, like a mini tower.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a bilevels cut, short in the front and long in the back.
meanings.sent5: The garden had a bilevels effect, with flowers blooming on the top and vegetables growing below.
